titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Thomas Frazier receipt to Lucien B. Chase 1977.607
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:16:36 +0000.

did.unittitle: Thomas Frazier receipt to Lucien B. Chase
did.abstract: A billing receipt to Lucien B. Chase of Brooklyn from Thomas Frazier for drawing up deeds, bonds and mortgages, as well as tax and title searches for 105 Adelphi Street, where Chase resided and practiced medicine. Dated 1881.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Thomas Frazier receipt to Lucien B. Chase, 1977.607, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.
